thread.title: Macau Casino Shares Jump After China Visitors, Reported Support
thread.title_full: Macau Casino Shares Jump After China Visitors, Reported Support - Bloomberg Business

author: Stephanie Wong
title: Macau Casino Shares Jump After China Visitors, Reported Support
text:
Macau casino shares jumped in Hong Kong trading after Chinese visitors to the world’s largest gambling hub surged during the Golden Week holiday and reports that China may move to support the city’s economy.
Galaxy Entertainment Group Ltd. surged as much as 9.9 percent to HK$23.85, the highest intraday level since Sept. 21. Sands China Ltd. and Wynn Macau Ltd. rose more than 8 percent, with SJM Holdings Ltd. up 7.9 percent and MGM China Holdings Ltd. climbing 5 percent. The benchmark Hang Seng Index gained as much as 2.2 percent.
Visitors from China rose 22 percent to 276,557 on Oct. 1 and Oct. 2, the first two days of the nation’s weeklong holiday, according to data from the Macau Government Tourist Office. The total number of travelers to the city rose 13.4 percent to 327,186, it said.
